title: Jim Brady, Press Secretary Turned Gun Control Activist, Dies At 73
teaser: Jim Brady, the White House press secretary who was shot in the head by a gunman trying to assassinate President Reagan, has died at age 73.  NPR's Brian Naylor reports on a man whose later life was dedicated to changing gun laws.
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
